intro: Ericoides muscari, commonly known as the musk mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has hairy, oval-shaped leaves and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Ericoides muscari is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
